New Records: Chris Bassitt won for the first time since Aug. 6 against Baltimore.

Chris Bassitt has won 10 or more decisions in each of the past four seasons, joining José Berríos, Corbin Burnes, Kevin Gausman, Framber Valdez, Logan Webb and Zack Wheeler as the only big league pitchers to do so.
Key Match Events: Davis Schneider hit a two-run triple
Ernie Clement scored three runs and Leo Jiménez reached base three times and drove in a run
Chris Bassitt struck out eight against his former team
Mets left-hander David Peterson (9-2) was charged with five runs, four earned, and a season-high tying eight hits in 4 1/3 innings
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Bassitt said he hopes the Mets make the playoffs.
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said they just couldn't get the big hit.
Mets left-hander David Peterson said he let the third get away from him and didn't stop the bleeding fast enough.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bassitt hit Mets slugger Pete Alonso with a 70 mph sweeper in the third inning.
Left-hander Brendon Little got one out in the seventh and righty Zach Pop got the final two, striking out Pete Alonso to end the frame and strand a runner at third base.
Mets RHP Paul Blackburn will not be available to face Philadelphia this weekend, Mendoza said.
Blue Jays SS Bo Bichette (right calf) went 1 for 3 with a single in his first rehab game with Triple-A Buffalo.
Others: RHP Bowden Francis (8-4, 3.72 ERA) is scheduled to start for the Blue Jays in Wednesday's series finale.
LHP Sean Manaea (11-5, 3.43) goes for the Mets.
